intro: Styphelia gjellerupii, commonly known as the Gjellerup heath, is a low-growing evergreen shrub native to the coastal regions of southern Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heaths and heathers, and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant features small, leathery leaves that are typically dark green and covered in fine, white hairs. Its flowers are usually pink or white, appearing in clusters at the ends of the stems, and bloom during the spring and summer months. Styphelia gjellerupii thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in heathlands and coastal dunes.
